New Records: Andries Gous and Harmeet Singh's 91 run-stand is the second-highest for the sixth wicket or lower in all T20 World Cups
Key Match Events: Quinton de Kock scored 74 runs, his highest T20 World Cup score
Kagiso Rabada took 3 wickets for 18 runs
Andries Gous scored an unbeaten 80 runs
Heinrich Klaasen and Tristan Stubbs shared a fifth-wicket partnership of 53 runs
Rabada and Anrich Nortje kept USA at bay in the final overs
Pre-Game Insights: There was a debate on which of the three seamers to leave out, with Rabada being chosen for his experience
Post-Match Reflections: Rabada repaid the decision to include him by taking crucial wickets and controlling the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: USA's fielding was notable with excellent catches by Anderson, Jahangir, and Ali Khan
USA's bowling was mixed, with Netravalkar and Harmeet being economical while others were expensive
